channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Russia launches strikes on Ukraine's capital as new peace proposal is on the table
item.description: Russia launched fresh strikes on Ukraine's capital Tuesday, as both countries weigh a new peace plan aimed at ending the war.
item.content:encoded: Russia launched fresh strikes on Ukraine's capital Tuesday, as both countries weigh a new peace plan aimed at ending the war.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: What Russia wants from the peace deal with Ukraine
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin asks Russia-U.S. relations expert Julia Ioffe what Russia is seeking from a peace deal with Ukraine.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin asks Russia-U.S. relations expert Julia Ioffe what Russia is seeking from a peace deal with Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Pentagon investigating Sen. Mark Kelly for telling troops to refuse 'illegal orders'
item.description: The Pentagon is opening an inquiry into Democratic Sen. Mark Kelly after the retired Navy captain and other Democrats recorded a video urging military members not to comply with illegal orders.
item.content:encoded: The Pentagon is opening an inquiry into Democratic Sen. Mark Kelly after the retired Navy captain and other Democrats recorded a video urging military members not to comply with illegal orders.
item.dc:creator: Quil Lawrence

item.title: Utah Gov. Cox appealed for civility after Charlie Kirk's murder. Did America listen?
item.description: After right-wing activist Charlie Kirk was assassinated, Utah Gov. Spencer Cox called for civility. NPR's Steve Inskeep spoke with him at a meeting of the Western Governors' Association.
item.content:encoded: After right-wing activist Charlie Kirk was assassinated, Utah Gov. Spencer Cox called for civility. NPR's Steve Inskeep spoke with him at a meeting of the Western Governors' Association.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Judge tosses cases against Comey and James, Russia launches strikes on Ukraine's capital as peace talks continue, Trump's moves against Maduro deepen as drug fight appears aimed at ousting regime.
item.content:encoded: Judge tosses cases against Comey and James, Russia launches strikes on Ukraine's capital as peace talks continue, Trump's moves against Maduro deepen as drug fight appears aimed at ousting regime.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: In a new book, Rep. Jim Clyburn highlights the Black politicians who paved the way for him
item.description: Jim Clyburn's new book, The First Eight, restores the lives of South Carolina's early Black congressmen and shows how their battles during Reconstruction offer lessons, and warnings, for politics today.
item.content:encoded:
Jim Clyburn's new book, The First Eight, restores the lives of South Carolina's early Black congressmen and shows how their battles during Reconstruction offer lessons, and warnings, for politics today.

(Image credit: Donaven Doughty for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Trump's moves against Maduro deepen as drug fight appears aimed at ousting regime
item.description: The Trump administration's terror designation of Venezuela's leader is raising questions about whether the U.S. anti-drug trafficking campaign is really a bid for regime change.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration's terror designation of Venezuela's leader is raising questions about whether the U.S. anti-drug trafficking campaign is really a bid for regime change.
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: Venezuelan migrants in Florida weigh the call for regime change back home
item.description: Here and Now's Scott Tong talks with Michel Martin about what he learned from his trip to Doral, Florida, home to the highest concentration of migrants from Venezuela.
item.content:encoded: Here and Now's Scott Tong talks with Michel Martin about what he learned from his trip to Doral, Florida, home to the highest concentration of migrants from Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Scott Tong

item.title: 75 years later, Thanksgiving staple Jiffy corn muffin mix still costs less than $1
item.description: Jiffy corn muffins are an iconic, low-cost pantry staple introduced during the Depression. Thanksgiving is peak season for the company, which has been run by the same family for five generations.
item.content:encoded: Jiffy corn muffins are an iconic, low-cost pantry staple introduced during the Depression. Thanksgiving is peak season for the company, which has been run by the same family for five generations.
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: Transportation Department wants tougher rules for commercial driver's licenses
item.description: The Transportation Department wants to make it harder for immigrants to get commercial driver's licenses after a deadly crash involving a trucker from India. Critics say it's an immigration crackdown.
item.content:encoded: The Transportation Department wants to make it harder for immigrants to get commercial driver's licenses after a deadly crash involving a trucker from India. Critics say it's an immigration crackdown.
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose
